channel.title: Grok Interactive
channel.description: Grok Interactive's web developers create outstanding applications

item.title: Happy Developers are Good Developers
item.description: Any developer can relate to writing depressing code. Our industry is known for long hours and the resulting burnout that follows. Corporate America is full of managers that like to see code written, without caring if the code will ever launch. This grinds on the inner-nerd of every developer and they suffer.

item.title: Your Presence Is Required
item.description: It's time to start thinking about how classes and objects actually relate to each other.

item.title: Setting up Rails in Ubuntu
item.description: How to get a good Rails environment going in the world's most popular free and open source desktop

item.title: CSS Specificity
item.description: Style sheets, style tags, inline styles; if you could override a style and make it important, rest assured, it was.

item.title: Git Hooks for Checking Tabs vs Spaces
item.description: While wars rage on about why to use spaces or tabs over the other, we are not here to talk about why we do not use tabs in a project. No, no, we are here to talk about *git hooks*.

item.title: Save Me Not
item.description: Buttons just begged to be pushed. We design them that way. But what if they do not need to be pushed? A while back I hit a project requirement that a form for user data could not be submitted back to the server unless there had been a change. I did *way* more work (and made the browser do way more work) than necessary.

item.title: "In Javascript everything is an object!" Mmm, Wrong.
item.description: Most people will tell you that in javascript, everything is an object. That is not actually true, through the magic of auto-boxing javascript fools you into thinking it is an object. Quite a few of the things you use every day in javascript are actually primitives, not objects.

item.title: Javascript dot notation versus bracket notation
item.description: Javascript is one of those fun and unique languages that let you do things differently, just because. An example of this is the javascript object model. An object in javascript is simply a hashmap of key-value pairs where the key is always a string and the value can be anything.

item.title: Clean Templates with Stash
item.description: Using Stash in Expression Engine to create clean, readable templates

item.title: Laravel & Emacs - Part 1
item.description: Part 1 - Setting up The One True Editor to tackle Laravel development

item.title: Setting Up a PHPUnit Testing Environment
item.description: You should be testing. You know you should be testing. But you are not testing. Time to fix that.

item.title: Avoid obvious avenues of attack
item.description: This may seem like a no-brainer but when creating a new web application you should be conscious of and avoid obvious avenues of attack... I said it was a no-brainer.

item.title: Grok Welcomes Joshua Freeman to the Team
item.description: We are growing the team again. This time, we are welcoming our newest Groker, Joshua Freeman, as a software engineer. He will be joining our team as a PHP and Ruby on Rails developer.

item.title: Codeup for a Brighter Future
item.description: Last fall Grok Interactive was needing to hire a developer and expand the team. We had read hundreds of resumes, most with little to no practical programming experience. We quickly learned that many people wanted to be developers, but there were none to be found. The market was worse than we had realized.

item.title: State of the Industry Concerns
item.description: When your software goes from 'magic' to just another tool in your toolbox that you fully understand, then you can call yourself an expert. Until then, you have some learning to do.

item.title: Grok Welcomes Chris Hardee to the Team
item.description: Chris is a cofounder and CEO of 10BitWorks.com, also known as the San Antonio Hackerspace. Helping grow the tech and hacker communities in San Antonio is an important mission, and we are very excited to have Chris on our team.

item.title: Groking the Web
item.description: Today Grok Interactive, LLC officially opens our doors. For months we have been laying the foundation; creating the LLC, lawyers writing contracts, designers making logos, blogs being built. Today. Today it all goes live.
